New Records: Virat Kohli scored 85 runs, the highest by an Indian in this match.
KL Rahul scored 97 runs, the highest by an Indian in this match.
Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 35 runs.
Ravindra Jadeja took 3 wickets and scored 28 runs.
Mitchell Starc was the most economical bowler for Australia with 31 runs in 8 overs.
Key Match Events: Steve Smith's dismissal for 46 runs was a key turning point.
Pat Cummins' dismissal for 15 runs was another pivotal moment.
The final over defense by India was a high-pressure moment.
KL Rahul's 97-run innings was a standout performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia elected to bat first after winning the toss.
India focused on containing the Australian top order in the powerplay.
Post-Match Reflections: KL Rahul was named Player of the Match.
Virat Kohli reached a significant milestone in his ODI career.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at MA Chidambaram Stadium with 33,190 attendees.
It was the fifth match of the World Cup series.
Others: The match was a crucial victory for India in the World Cup campaign.
